intro: Stickmannia villosula, commonly known as the hairy stickman plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, stick-like appearance with hairy stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Stickmannia villosula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
